==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|きょう|こつ}}
{{IPAchar|/kepukotu/}} → {{IPAchar|/keɸukot͡su/}} → {{IPAchar|/keukot͡su/}} → {{IPAchar|/kjoːkot͡su/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きょうこつ}} compound {{m|zh|頰骨|tr=kiep? kwot|lit=cheek + bone}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|きょうこつ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きょうこつ|kyu=頰骨|hhira=けふこつ}}

# [[cheekbone]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|顴骨|かんこつ}} {{qualifier|less common, more formal}}
* {{ja-r|頬骨|ほおぼね}} {{qualifier|see below; more common}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ほお|ほね|k2=ぼね|r=y}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほおぼね|頬|tr1=hō|t1=cheek, jaw|骨|tr2=hone|t2=bone}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=ほおぼね|hone|bone}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ほおぼね|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ほおぼね|kyu=頰骨|hhira=ほほぼね}}

# [[cheekbone]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|頬骨|きょうこつ}} {{qualifier|less common, more formal}}
* {{ja-r|顴骨|かんこつ}} {{qualifier|less common, even more formal}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つら|ほね|k2=ぼね|r=y}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=つらぼね|頬|tr1=tsura|t1=face; cheek|骨|tr2=hone|t2=bone}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=つらぼね|hone|bone}} The ''tsura'' reading for {{ja-l|頬}} is rare.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つらぼね|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|面骨}} {{qualifier|more common spelling}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つらぼね|kyu=頰骨}}

# [[cheekbone]]
# one's [[facial features]], one's [[looks]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|cheekbone}} {{ja-r|頬骨|きょうこつ}} {{qualifier|see above; more formal}}
* {{sense|features}} {{ja-r|顔付き|かおつき}}, {{ja-r|顔立ち|かおだち}}, {{ja-r|面立ち|おもだち}}

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|en|cheekbone}} sense is more commonly expressed with the reading ''hōbone''.
